website_summaries.verdict: Delivers strong levels of performance in a high temperature range. Will minimize deposits and sludge.
pros: Meets all requirements for levels of performance for manual transmissions in GM vehicles (but will work in any vehicles)
Trustworthy brand name for all kinds of auto parts and products
Will deliver a smoother shifting process at higher gears for most vehicles
cons: May not deliver the shift improvements you're seeking at all gears

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best for Acura/Honda owners...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this fluid for about 40k miles in my daily Integra. So far I have changed it three times. I would estimate this fluid lasts about 15-20k miles depending on use. After that, it darkens,looses it's viscosity (watery), and magical abilities to fix notchy grindy shifts. But man, with a fresh change, I can practically shift with one finger. For $30 every 15k miles it's easily worth it. Before I was using honda mtf (old formula) and it was pratically useless. Then I started using this and noticed a huge improvement. Haven't tried the new honda mtf formula but highly doubt it works as well. It's a very thin fluid.
customer_reviews.author: T-dogg

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: Synchromesh is my favorite gearbox fluid for my Mustang and most Hondas. It provides remarkably smooth shifts compared to stock fluids. I used it in one Honda for 180k miles without any issues. The gearbox was still shifting smoothly when the car finally died with 235k miles. Unfortunately this fluid was not as smooth in my BMW gearbox. Redline turned out to be better. It just depends on your car. I would still recommend that anyone with a notchy or stiff gearbox start off with Synchromesh as their starting point.
customer_reviews.author: Lt. Frank Bullitt

customer_reviews.title: It worked like everyone had said it
customer_reviews.text: My 2005 accord V6 had issues with 3rd gear engagement but after replacing the transmission fluid with this AC Delco, I havent not had one issue. It worked like everyone had said it would
customer_reviews.author: Francis Palana

customer_reviews.title: Better than Honda MTF fluid
customer_reviews.text: I was having the common 2nd and 3rd gear rough shifting from the syncros not aligning perfectly. I tried the Pennzoil syncromesh and the Honda MTF and both were about the same it would go into gear but sometimes really really roughly. I just put this in 3 days ago and the transmission feels like it is new. I highly recommend this to anyone with a manual transmission Honda. I was seriously considering replacing the tranny but I have no reason to now it shifts so smoothly and I couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brogren802

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: I drive a 2010 honda accord v6 6-speed and a common issue with this particular model is when shifting into 3rd the clutch feels notchy and occasionally grinds. Well after extensive research on online forums evryone seemed to have solved the issue by replacing the factory transmission fluid with this. So i decided to order myself a couple quartz and give it a shot. BOY did this stuff make a diffrence. I am now proud to say that my car shifts "as smooth as buttahh" and more importantly no more grinding. I was so happy i now recommend it to all my fellow 8th gen accord friends!
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Used in my 1998 Chevrolet C1500 4.3 l and improved shifting while reducing noise
customer_reviews.text: Used in my 1998 Chevrolet C1500 4.3 l with a manual transmission and significantly reduced ease of shifting. My truck calls for this fluid and despite being more expensive than most manual transmission fluids it improves shifting and reduces noise. Instead of pumping this fluid through the small holes in the transmission, I took the shifter off and poured it directly into the top of the transmission until it began flowing out of the upper fill hole. Proved much easier than pumping it out of the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Mota

customer_reviews.title: May be the best synchromesh fluid out there!
customer_reviews.text: One word: WOW! Shifting on my newly acquired 2000 VW Golf TDI was really a struggle, hard and notchy. This fluid created an instantaneous transformation to a very pleasant shifting experience: I have a Sigma 5 short shifter, and the combo is just fantastic. This fluid was also put in to my wife's TDI (another 2000 VW Golf) and, though hers shifted fairly well to start with, it just polished it off. All the research I did really paid off; I found no one who tried this fluid that ended up taking it out (can't say that about other fluids out there).
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: GET IT! (manual transmission)
customer_reviews.text: Gives golden shifting on my '85 Toyota Celica that had wrecked synchros on first through third gears. So much better than other offerings that I would call this fluid a mandatory addition. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: Iren Masot

customer_reviews.title: Honda tranny best friend
customer_reviews.text: If you own a honda with a manual gearbox this is the fluid to use forget aboth the honda stuff. I learned about this stuff when i had a 2008 acura tl manual it had a 3rd gear grind after using this stuff I never had a problem again it literally shifted like butter now I use it on my s2000 and same results highly recommend if you gearbox is notchy this stuff will take care of it. Just make sure its the "friction modified"
customer_reviews.author: al1582

customer_reviews.title: Wish I can keep using it.
customer_reviews.text: Works really great with my 07' Honda accord 5 speed manual transmission. I would love to keep using it but it just got too expensive for me to use. Switched back to Honda mtf. It is an amazing mtf though.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Manual transmission noise seems to of gone away after using this for a month.
customer_reviews.text: 2003 a10 manual transmission noise cured. The wining noise in my Manual transmission seems to of gone away after using this for a month. It must have chased out the bad and lubricated some problem area.
customer_reviews.author: Jack K.

customer_reviews.title: Anecdotally, the best oil I’ve ever used!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff worked great on my Nissan Versa 2018 (manual gear box), reducing noise and become more easy to change geara. Much better than the previously oil, a Valvoline MTF. Buy it!!
customer_reviews.author: Paulo Henrique Lima Polato

customer_reviews.title: I didn’t get my money’s worth
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 but only got 2. Having a hard time trying to find out how to get the 3rd bottle or reimbursed. What I did get, was mailed in a timely fashion though.
customer_reviews.author: Shasta

customer_reviews.title: Helped my Acura tranny
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my Acura RSX with 180K mile and a 1 year old clutch. I always used oem Honda MTF befroe, but the shifting was starting to feel a little notchy, especially downshifts in hot weather. I read in some Honda/Acura threads about using this. So I tried a 50/50 mix of this Synchromesh and MTF. This ACDelco is definitely thicker than Honda MTF, so I didn't want to use it straight. My car shifts much smoother now. All good.
customer_reviews.author: Davey C

customer_reviews.title: No more 3rd gear pop out
customer_reviews.text: 3rd gear would pop out a lot and it was so f$&$*king annoying! looked into why and saw people mentioning new transmission fluid and heard this brand is really good. so I went with it and replace the fluid and got rid of the dreaded 3rd gear pop out. Shifts feel about the same, doesnt feel way smoother or anything like that. Maybe a tiny bit smoother but nothing major.
customer_reviews.author: anthony c.

customer_reviews.title: 2006 Acura TL 6 spd MT - 2002 Subaru WRX
customer_reviews.text: I've used this is my 2002 Subaru WRX 5 speed manual and 2005 ACURA TL 6 speed manual transmission. Not only did it shift like it was new but it cured the "notchiness" in 3rd gear that Acura/Honda 6 speed MT's notoriously experienced in the mid '00 models. It also made the WRX shift like it was brand new and upgraded! If you have either one of these vehicles, USE THIS ASAP!! You can thank me later!
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Works great, shifts like butter now
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on my 2005 Acura RSX. Note that you need 1.5 bottles for a drain and refill on that model.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisA

customer_reviews.title: GM Fluids FTW
customer_reviews.text: 98 Accord seems quite pleased with this fluid. Very smooth shifts. Doesn't crank/grind into reverse anymore. Occasionally, this brand is cheap enough that you can change your transmission oil for less than a Ulysses. Between Syncromesh and Dexcool, I'm pretty happy with GM's automotive fluid development.
customer_reviews.author: T Markworth

customer_reviews.title: Used in a Honda MT
customer_reviews.text: Used in a 2004 Honda manual transmission. Gear changes are a bit smoother now.
customer_reviews.author: emeron

customer_reviews.title: Magical
customer_reviews.text: There is some serious witchcraft going on in this stuff. I was certain the synchros (particularly 3rd) in my 2005 Acura TL 6MT were ruined by the previous owner. Nope, this fixed it, pretty much immediately too. If you have a Honda/Acura manual that shifts like crap, you owe it to yourself to get some of this stuff. The difference is anything but subtle.
customer_reviews.author: Cheeseybacon

customer_reviews.title: Better than Honda MTF, Doubles as Cologne
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for over 6 years now in my 2006 Honda Accord 6spd with no issues. Shifts are smooth. Buy 3, you'll need a little over 2 qts for a spill and fill. I usually take the extra fluid and fragrance my neck with a few dabs before I hit the town, ladies love it.!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sparano

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly as stated, great replacement part.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome alternative to using auto trans fluid in my manual trans. Took away the slight grinds between gears and smoother shifting.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Smooth shifts
customer_reviews.text: Made my 6spd shift like new. Very nice lubricant. Super smooth shifts. 05 Acura TL
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Great, way better than OEM
customer_reviews.text: This product really cleaned up the shifts on my S2000. I lost all notchiness in first and second, 3rd still does it a bit when cold, but when hot it's back to buttery smooth shifting. Seems like Honda 6 speeds, whether S2000 or Acura TLs have the same internal components, but with different fwd/rwd transmissions of course.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used this instead of the Honda MTF. WHAT A DIFFERENCE! No more notchy shifts!
customer_reviews.author: Paul A Rittner

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Works great in a Sonoma 5 speed. Stinks but it works
customer_reviews.author: Jason Struckman

customer_reviews.title: Believe the HYPE
customer_reviews.text: Stuff works wonders on manual transmission Honda/Acura cars. Better than OEM dealer stuff. Didn't believe it till I tried it, and all I can say this stuff makes the car shift super smooth like "BUTTA".
customer_reviews.author: e-rock

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Used in my 05 SRT4 helped smooth out shifting. plus doesn't smell like mopar atf+4 cat pee
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Holy Cow
customer_reviews.text: Acura RSX type S. This oil managed to fix my issue in third gear. Always grinned not anymore, the shift is smooth and no longer grinds. 5/5 if you have similar issue give this oil a chance worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Bloodx

customer_reviews.title: Beating the horse back to life.
customer_reviews.text: As everyone and their best friend and their neighbor have mentioned, it's worked WONDERS for my 02 Honda Civic. Cold shifting noises have mostly gone away, only noises come from user error when shifting in a hurry. it's not a miracle fluid after all.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P.

customer_reviews.title: ... in my 6 speed with this and it shifts like brand new
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my the Honda fluid in my 6 speed with this and it shifts like brand new. I'm very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Works great for manual Hondas
customer_reviews.text: Was sceptical about putting this in my 2009 manual Accord v6 at first. Every mechanic I talked to said to only use oem Honda transmission fluid. But I got to say, after using this fluid, my transmission shifts so much smoother and doesn't grind going into 3rd anymore. Very impressed
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Gilchrist

customer_reviews.title: Worked excellent in my 2004 Acura TL 6-speed
customer_reviews.text: Worked excellent in my 2004 Acura TL 6-speed. Trans used to miss 3rd gear but no longer. This is the right fluid for the Acura manual trans. No doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur J. Coombs

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This arrived quickly and was well packed. I was hoping it would improve my T500's shifting but it did not. I later found out that it is the stock fluid used in these transmissions.
customer_reviews.author: Lyzerd

customer_reviews.title: 1999 BMW M3
customer_reviews.text: Excellent transmission fluid. Using this in my 1999 BMW M3, manual transmission (ZF).
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wrzesinski

customer_reviews.title: A must for Acura TL 6MT owners!
customer_reviews.text: I recently used this in my 08 Acura TL Type-S 6MT which suffered from the notorious notchy 3rd gear. After reading how many people had used this with success in the Honda/Acura community Id give it a shot. I was skeptical as I only use OEM Honda fluids but figured if I didn't get the results everyone else did I could always switch back to the Honda MTF. I couldn't be more impressed! I Immediately noticed a difference on the first drive. All gears are super smooth and 3rd gear issues are gone. If you own a Honda/Acura with a 3rd gear notch/pop out, this stuff is for you
customer_reviews.author: GD

customer_reviews.title: Great for Acura TL Manual Trans
customer_reviews.text: Third time I purchased this gear oil for my 2005 acura tl manual trans. Ive used it ever since I had the 3 gear grind issue at 15,000 miles. Im now at over 140,000 and it still shifts great.
customer_reviews.author: billm FD3

customer_reviews.title: Used in Honda 6pd trans
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace the tranny fluid in my 06 Honda v6 manual trans.It did make the shifts much smother than the factory Honda fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Jett1

customer_reviews.title: Feels better than 100% MTF
customer_reviews.text: Mixed it 50/50 with Honda MTF in a Stock '97 GSR trans. Feels better than 100% MTF. Smoother shifts and engages well. I've got no reason why not to give it 5 starts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good lube
customer_reviews.text: Good product, used in VW tdi manual trans. Per recommendations on Jetta Forum

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Makes my Hyundai Genesis coupe 6sp manual transmission shift like butter.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Completely cured my 2006 Accord 6 speed manual transmission of the difficult 2-3 upshift that plagues that transmission.

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE FOR K SERIES TRANSMISSIONS
customer_reviews.text: Saved my transmission , had a notch in 3rd and 5th bad, now all my gears go through very smooth. Highly recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Honda manual trans
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff for an old Honda manual transmission. Transmission shift like new.

customer_reviews.title: I doubt it works better than Honda MTF but it's worth trying
customer_reviews.text: Using this in my 1995 Civic EX. Works well. I doubt it works better than Honda MTF but it's worth trying.

customer_reviews.title: I now have 136k on my S2000 and the transmission running great. I replace the fluid once a year (12k-15k ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for several years since I have my 2006 Honda S2000. I now have 136k on my S2000 and the transmission running great. I replace the fluid once a year (12k-15k miles). Smooth shifting.
customer_reviews.author: Las Vegas Casinos

customer_reviews.title: Isuzu j-body transmission fluid
customer_reviews.text: Used in J body stick shift Isuzu transmission. As long as I have this vehicle this is the product to use. Unless you like grinding gears in cold weather, this works

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is pretty awesome. Takes a few days to circulate through but it improved my Honda's shifting noticeably.

customer_reviews.title: Improvement over OE Honda fluid
customer_reviews.text: Used it to get rid of 3rd gear grind on my Accord Coupe V6 six speed. Works great, much better than OE Honda MTF.

customer_reviews.title: wow!
customer_reviews.text: Just bought a 2003 Acura CL type s w 6speed manual transmission. It was grinding when shifting into second if you shifted quickly. I bought this fluid and the instant change was AMAZING! I was sure the 2nd gear synchro was bad but it's fine now. I highly recommend this product!!

customer_reviews.title: The oil to use if your synchos are weak.
customer_reviews.text: Running this oil has almost eliminated completely the terribly worn synchro grind. Stuffs amazing.

customer_reviews.title: No more third gear issues!
customer_reviews.text: Got rid of the 3rd gear problem in an '06 Acura TL. Shifts smoother than ever!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good price, good lube, good shifting. Used in 04 wrangler manual tranny.

customer_reviews.title: Does Wonders!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff does wonders for the 6mt TL and other manual Acura/Hondas. I had the known 3rd gear issue when i first bought my TL 3 years ago, I put this in and there hasn't been an issue since.

customer_reviews.title: you must have it
customer_reviews.text: this stuff is amazing.i had problems with 3rd gear in my 2007 honda civic type r.yesterday ive changed gearbox oil and everything is silky smooth now pure pleasure.

customer_reviews.text: 9th Gen Honda Accord MT with some notchy shifting from 1st to 2nd. As with my 2 other Hondas, this oil cured the (otherwise awesome) shifting between the gears.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I drive a 2010 Acura TL. The notchiness is gone, as well as the gear popping out of third. I have driven about 1000km so far with the new transmission oil. I highly recommend.

customer_reviews.text: Very good fluid... The transmission was a little rough between 1st and 2nd gear, but now it's perfect. Good price

customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended by people on the Acura forum, and they were right! I really notice a difference in my 6-speed manual.

customer_reviews.title: Now it just feels like butter, all the time
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using this for a day so far so I don't know the long term effects - but - this stuff is magical. Before I had trouble getting the shifter into first gear, and I would grind going into third. Now it just feels like butter, all the time. I had regular synchromesh fluid in there before and the difference is noticeable. This is on a 93 Honda Accord. I will be buying more to try on my Pontiac.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: must have for any manual oil change.
customer_reviews.text: Changed out the tyranny fluid out of my crx and it shifts to any gear with ease. Reverse use to take about two or three tries before it engages but no more, one shot and we're in gear. I decided to try snychromesh because of all the wonderful reviews. I am a believer 😁.

product_meta.title: ACDelco 10-4014 Friction Modified Synchromesh Manual Transmission Fluid - 32 oz
product_meta.description: Size:32 OunceSynchromesh Transmission Fluid, Friction Modified is a synthetic blend manual transmission fluid designed specifically for use in GM manual transmissions. This fluid has excellent lubrication properties that prevent breakdown over time and reduce friction to minimize transmission wear. This synchromesh transmission fluid is for use only in New Venture NV1500 manual transmissions. See service manual for GM vehicle application.
feature_bullets: Formulated specifically for synchromesh transmissions, resulting in excellent synchronizer performance
Minimizes sludge and varnish deposits to provide for a cleaner transmission
Protects against surface distress, minimizing spalling, pitting, rust, corrosion, and overall wear
All-climate fluid that manages temperatures as low as -40 degrees Fahrenheit (-40 degrees Celsius) to as high as 300 degrees Fahrenheit (149 degrees Celsius)
Highly friction modified to reduce overall transmission component wear
